contents.content: Vision:

At SPAN Consulting, our vision is to stand as the pre-eminent authority in Brand Protection Services, pioneering innovation and trust to safeguard our clients' intellectual property, reputation, and revenue. We aspire to set new industry standards, ensuring our clients and their stakeholders' security and confidence.
Mission:

Our mission at SPAN Consulting is to forge a united and resilient consortium for Brand Protection Services. We aim to leverage collective strength, industry leadership, and cutting-edge technologies to develop tailored solutions that combat counterfeiting, product diversion and intellectual property infringements. By doing so, we aim to protect the interests of our clients while upholding the highest standards of ethics and professionalism.
SPAN: Strategic Partner for Advanced Navigation

Strategic: "Strategic" represents our core competence in providing strategic guidance and innovative solutions to our clients. We excel in developing comprehensive strategies that align with their long-term objectives and navigating the complexities of their challenges.

Partner: "Partner" signifies our commitment to building strong, collaborative, and enduring relationships with our clients. We don't just advise; we become trusted partners invested in our clients' success.

Advanced: "Advanced" embodies our dedication to staying at the forefront of industry advancements and innovation. We continually seek new approaches and technologies to deliver cutting-edge solutions.
Navigation: "Navigation" symbolizes our role in helping clients navigate the intricate landscapes of their industries and markets. We guide them toward their goals with precision and expertise

This expanded acronym captures the essence of SPAN Consulting's values, culture, mission, and vision by emphasizing its strategic approach, commitment to partnership and collaboration, dedication to innovation, and role as a trusted navigator in the business world. It reflects the organization's mission to empower clients to thrive in a dynamic and ever-evolving landscape.

We are proud of our values. They are non-negotiable and guide everything we do. Client and Customer focus is about always doing the right thing for our clients and their patients, consumers and customers and striving for the highest quality. Transparency helps us build trust with each other and with society by being honest and open about how and what we do. Respect means supporting colleagues and the communities around us, and embracing diversity and individuality, so we can all achieve great things. Integrity is about how we expect the highest ethical behaviours of ourselves and others.
Funding of Shared Services:
Shared services are funded by the business units within SPAN Consulting that benefit from these services. We shall consider the following funding practices:
Full Cost Recovery: Aim to recover 100% of shared services' direct and indirect costs from the business units. This ensures that shared services are financially self-sustaining.
Usage-Based Model: Establish rates for each service based on usage metrics (e.g., number of employees, server usage, marketing campaign requests) to allocate costs fairly to business units.
Transparent Budgeting: Develop an annual shared services budget that outlines expected expenses and revenue targets. Business units contribute based on their anticipated usage.
We offer a comprehensive suite of services to safeguard your intellectual property (IP) and turn it into a powerful business advantage. Our expertise covers
1. Securing Your Innovation:
IP Registration & Prosecution: Expertly navigate the process of registering your patents, trademarks, copyrights, and designs worldwide.
Custom Recordation: Secure your IP rights with customs authorities to prevent counterfeit imports and safeguard your brand.
2. Defending Your Innovation:
Audits & Investigations: Identify and address internal vulnerabilities to prevent IP theft and unauthorized use.
Product Security: Proactively assess and mitigate product security risks, ensuring consumer safety and brand reputation.
Enforcement: Aggressively pursue infringements through civil, criminal, and administrative measures, working with law enforcement and regulatory agencies.
3 Optimizing Your Innovation:
Risk Consulting & Mitigation: Identify and manage legal and business risks associated with your IP, developing custom mitigation plans.
Supply Chain Integrity: Secure your supply chain through risk assessments, investigations, and robust integrity programs.
Stakeholder Training: Empower your team, law enforcement, and customs officials with comprehensive IP training programs.
Market Research: Gain valuable insights into market trends and competitor activity to inform your IP strategy.
Beyond just protection, we empower you to leverage your IP for maximum value and sustainable growth.
PANKAJ MONGA

Pankaj is an accomplished Lawyer and an Advocate of the Supreme Court of India with over 24+ years of experience and an impressive track record in the Pharma and healthcare industry. He has successfully led strategic legal and brand protection functions for renowned multinational organisations such as Johnson & Johnson and GlaxoSmithKline pan Asia Pacific and, through his collaborative work with clients, has always ensured the highest standards of patient/consumer safety, trust, and business value by effectively mitigating risks. He has a BA from Andhra University, an LLB from Delhi University and an Executive MBA from IIM Calcutta.
NUPUR SINGH

Dynamic logistics professional with 15 years of extensive experience in supply chain management and procurement within the Indian Air Force (IAF). Demonstrated expertise in orchestrating complex international supply chains, optimizing procurement processes, and ensuring efficient distribution. Proficient in managing supply chains for different aircraft and weapon systems, exceeding ₹300 crores in value, while collaborating with Western, Russian, and domestic vendors to streamline procurement and achieve cost savings. Skilled in formulating procurement strategies including RFI/RFP, Bid Evaluation, Supply Orders, and Contracts to meet organizational objectives. Established and implemented SOPs for Receipt and Despatch, standardizing processes and disseminating best practices across divisions.  Additionally, provided expertise in project management, HR management, and appraisal systems, contributing to organizational effectiveness.

1) CEO

The CEO is responsible for setting strategic objectives, ensuring financial stability, fostering client relationships, managing the firm's team, driving business development efforts, maintaining compliance with legal and ethical standards, promoting innovation, and enhancing the firm's public image. In broad terms, the CEO serves as the primary decision-maker and leader, guiding the firm towards its goals while upholding its values and reputation in the legal industry. They play a critical role in shaping the firm's strategy, managing its operations, and driving growth and success in the competitive landscape of intellectual property law.
• BRAND PROTECTION & LEGAL SERVICE UNIT

The Brand Protection & Legal Service Unit, nestled within the Legal Division of an Intellectual Property Rights (IPR) law firm, assumes a pivotal role in safeguarding clients' interests by diligently protecting their intellectual property assets. Primarily tasked with overseeing trademark, copyright, and patent protection, the unit meticulously manages clients' portfolios, from conducting thorough searches to prosecuting applications and enforcing rights against infringement. This entails a multifaceted approach, including trademark monitoring, copyright registration, and patent prosecution, all aimed at securing and preserving clients' exclusive rights. In addition to proactive protection measures, the unit remains vigilant in monitoring the market for any signs of infringement or unauthorized use, promptly taking enforcement actions when necessary. Beyond enforcement, they offer comprehensive legal counseling, advising clients on various IP matters, such as licensing agreements, domain name disputes, and IP litigation strategies. Collaborating closely with other units within the Legal Division, the Brand Protection & Legal Service Unit ensures a holistic approach to IP protection, integrating advanced technologies where appropriate to enhance efficiency and effectiveness. By providing strategic guidance, proactive risk management, and diligent enforcement, the unit serves as a trusted partner to clients, empowering them to maximize the value of their intellectual property assets while minimizing risks in an ever-evolving legal landscape.
Legal Division

Within the Legal Division, the Brand Protection & Legal Service Unit takes on distinct responsibilities focused on safeguarding clients' intellectual property (IP) assets. While other units within the division may handle a broad spectrum of legal matters, including corporate law, litigation, and regulatory compliance, the Brand Protection & Legal Service Unit specializes specifically in IP law. Their tasks primarily revolve around trademark, copyright, and patent protection, encompassing activities such as trademark searches, copyright registrations, and patent prosecution. This specialization allows them to provide tailored legal advice and strategic guidance to clients solely on matters pertaining to IP rights. Additionally, the unit assumes a proactive role in monitoring the market for potential infringement or misuse of clients' IP assets, which distinguishes their responsibilities from those of other units focused on general legal services. By specializing in IP law and dedicating their efforts to protecting and enforcing clients' intellectual property rights, the Brand Protection & Legal Service Unit enhances the Legal Division's ability to deliver comprehensive and specialized legal services in the field of intellectual property.
Intelligence & Technology Division

the Intelligence and Technology Division stands as a cornerstone, uniquely positioned to navigate the intricate intersection of law and technology in safeguarding clients' intellectual property assets. This division assumes multifaceted responsibilities, ranging from conducting exhaustive research on emerging technologies and market dynamics to harnessing advanced data analytics. In cases of intellectual property disputes, the division provides invaluable support through digital forensics investigations, uncovering evidence of infringement or misuse of intellectual property online. With expertise spanning emerging technologies such as artificial intelligence and blockchain, the division offers strategic counsel on the unique IP considerations associated with these domains. Through client education initiatives and training sessions, the Intelligence and Technology Division empowers clients to navigate the complexities of IP protection in the digital age, cementing its status as an indispensable ally in the pursuit of safeguarding and maximizing the value of intellectual property assets.
a) OSINT, HUMINT, CROSINT specialist

The use of OSINT allows our division to harness publicly available information from sources such as social media, news articles, and online databases to gather intelligence on potential threats to our clients' intellectual property. By monitoring online forums, social media platforms, and industry publications, we can identify emerging trends, track competitor activities, and uncover instances of trademark or copyright infringement.

Moreover, the deployment of HUMINT specialists enables us to gather intelligence through direct human interaction, whether through interviews, surveys, or informal conversations. This human-centric approach allows us to gain valuable insights into the intentions and actions of individuals or organizations involved in intellectual property disputes. For example, HUMINT specialists may engage with industry insiders, employees, or informants to uncover valuable information about counterfeit operations or unauthorized use of clients' trademarks.

Additionally, the expertise of CROSINT specialists enables our division to synthesize information from diverse sources, including both open and closed channels, to generate comprehensive intelligence reports. By integrating data from OSINT, HUMINT, and other proprietary sources, CROSINT specialists provide a holistic view of the intellectual property landscape, enabling us to formulate informed strategies for protecting and enforcing our clients' rights.

In summary, the Intelligence and Technology Division's proficiency in OSINT, HUMINT, and CROSINT techniques empowers our firm to gather timely and accurate intelligence, identify potential threats to our clients' intellectual property, and devise proactive strategies to mitigate risks and safeguard their interests. By leveraging these intelligence-gathering capabilities, we enhance our ability to deliver strategic counsel and effective representation in intellectual property matters, thereby reinforcing our commitment to protecting and defending our clients' valuable assets.
b) Brand protection technology specialist

The Brand Protection and Technology Division is tasked with developing and implementing comprehensive strategies to protect our clients' brands from infringement, counterfeiting, and unauthorized use. Leveraging advanced technology tools and platforms, such as digital fingerprinting, image recognition software, and online monitoring systems, the division monitors various online channels, including e-commerce platforms, social media networks, and websites, to identify potential threats to our clients' trademarks, copyrights, and patents.

Moreover, the division collaborates closely with legal teams to gather evidence of online infringement and develop enforcement actions. This may involve issuing cease-and-desist letters, filing takedown notices with online service providers, or pursuing litigation against infringing parties. The division's expertise in digital forensics and cyber investigations enables them to trace the source of infringing activities and identify individuals or entities responsible for IP violations.

In addition to reactive enforcement measures, the Brand Protection and Technology Division also focuses on proactive brand protection strategies. This includes conducting trademark audits, monitoring domain name registrations, and implementing brand reputation management initiatives to prevent potential infringements and protect our clients' brand integrity.

Furthermore, the division serves as a valuable resource for clients, providing guidance on best practices for online brand protection, cybersecurity, and data privacy compliance. Through educational initiatives and training programs, they empower clients to navigate the complexities of IP enforcement in the digital age and mitigate potential risks to their brand reputation and market share.

In summary, the Brand Protection and Technology Division plays a critical role in our firm's efforts to protect and enforce our clients' intellectual property rights. By combining expertise in brand protection strategies with advanced technological capabilities, they contribute to our firm's mission of providing strategic counsel and effective representation in intellectual property matters, ultimately safeguarding our clients' valuable assets and competitive advantage in the marketplace.
Strategy & Compliance Division

This specialized division is tasked with developing and implementing tailored strategies to address legal and regulatory requirements, mitigate risks, and optimize opportunities for our clients across various industries.

The Strategy and Compliance Division collaborates closely with legal teams and client stakeholders to conduct comprehensive assessments of regulatory requirements and industry standards relevant to our clients' operations. By staying abreast of changes in laws, regulations, and market trends, the division provides strategic counsel on compliance matters, helping clients navigate potential legal pitfalls and minimize exposure to regulatory risks.

Moreover, the division assists clients in developing proactive compliance programs and policies tailored to their specific needs and industry requirements. This includes drafting and implementing compliance manuals, conducting employee training programs, and establishing internal controls to promote a culture of compliance within organizations.

In addition to compliance efforts, the Strategy and Compliance Division plays a key role in guiding clients through strategic decision-making processes. This may involve conducting risk assessments, performing due diligence for mergers and acquisitions, and advising on corporate governance matters to ensure alignment with legal and business objectives.
• BUSINESS RISK ADVISORY AND STRATEGIC CONSULTING UNIT

The Business Risk Advisory and Strategic Consulting Unit works closely with legal teams and client stakeholders to conduct comprehensive assessments of the various risks faced by our clients, including legal, regulatory, financial, operational, and reputational risks. By leveraging a combination of qualitative and quantitative analysis, the unit identifies potential vulnerabilities and develops proactive strategies to mitigate risks and optimize business performance.

Moreover, the unit provides strategic counsel on a wide range of business issues, including market entry strategies, mergers and acquisitions, corporate governance, and crisis management. Drawing upon industry expertise and market insights, the unit helps clients make informed decisions that drive growth, enhance competitiveness, and maximize shareholder value.

In addition to risk mitigation and strategic consulting, the unit offers specialized expertise in areas such as cybersecurity, data privacy, environmental sustainability, and corporate social responsibility. By staying abreast of emerging trends and regulatory developments, the unit helps clients anticipate and address evolving challenges, ensuring compliance with legal requirements and industry best practices.
Risk & Crisis Management Division

The Risk & Crisis Management Division works collaboratively with legal teams and client stakeholders to conduct comprehensive risk assessments and develop customized risk management plans tailored to each client's specific needs and objectives. By identifying potential vulnerabilities across various areas, including legal, regulatory, operational, financial, and reputational risks, the division helps clients implement proactive measures to minimize exposure and protect against potential liabilities.

Moreover, the division provides strategic counsel on crisis preparedness and response, helping clients develop robust crisis management protocols and communication strategies to effectively navigate unexpected events such as data breaches, product recalls, litigation, natural disasters, or reputational crises. By establishing clear roles and responsibilities, implementing escalation procedures, and conducting crisis simulations, the division ensures that clients are well-equipped to respond swiftly and decisively in the event of a crisis.

In addition to crisis response services, the division offers ongoing monitoring and surveillance to detect early warning signs of potential risks and emerging threats. By staying abreast of industry trends, regulatory developments, and geopolitical events, the division helps clients anticipate and mitigate potential risks before they escalate into full-blown crises.
Strategic Planning & Project Management Division

Furthermore, the division serves as a trusted advisor to executive leadership teams, providing strategic guidance and crisis management training to build organizational resilience and instill confidence in stakeholders. Whether advising on reputation management strategies, stakeholder engagement, or regulatory compliance, the division plays a critical role in helping clients protect and enhance their brand reputation and market standing.

The Strategic Planning and Project Management Division works closely with legal teams, consultants, and client stakeholders to develop comprehensive strategic plans tailored to each client's unique needs and business goals. By conducting thorough assessments of market dynamics, competitive landscapes, and regulatory environments, the division helps clients identify opportunities for growth, differentiation, and risk mitigation.

Moreover, the division oversees the execution of strategic initiatives and consulting projects, providing expert project management support to ensure timely delivery, budget adherence, and quality outcomes. This includes defining project scope, establishing clear milestones and deliverables, allocating resources effectively, and monitoring progress against key performance indicators.

In addition to strategic planning and project management, the division plays a crucial role in guiding clients through the implementation of brand protection strategies. This may involve developing comprehensive brand protection plans, conducting intellectual property audits, monitoring online and offline channels for potential infringements, and coordinating enforcement actions to safeguard clients' trademarks, copyrights, and patents.

Furthermore, the division serves as a central hub for collaboration and communication between internal teams and external stakeholders, facilitating alignment on strategic priorities and ensuring seamless execution of client engagements. By fostering a culture of collaboration, accountability, and continuous improvement, the division enhances the firm's ability to deliver value-added services and exceed client expectations.     a) Flawless Execution & Delivery Specialists

The Flawless Execution and Delivery Specialist within the Strategic Planning and Project Management Division plays a pivotal role in ensuring the smooth and successful implementation of strategic plans and consulting projects. Tasked with overseeing the execution phase, this specialist meticulously coordinates all aspects of project delivery, meticulously managing resources, timelines, and budgets to uphold the highest standards of quality and efficiency. Through proactive monitoring of progress and diligent risk management, the specialist navigates potential obstacles and ensures that projects are completed on time, within budget, and to the satisfaction of our clients. Their commitment to flawless execution not only enhances our firm's reputation for excellence but also contributes to the achievement of our clients' strategic objectives and long-term success
Innovation & Digital Transformation division

This specialized division is dedicated to harnessing innovative technologies and strategies to revolutionize our approach to legal services, enhance client experiences, and stay ahead of industry trends.

The Innovation & Digital Transformation Division collaborates closely with legal teams, technology experts, and client stakeholders to identify opportunities for leveraging digital solutions and automation in our service delivery. By embracing emerging technologies such as artificial intelligence, machine learning, blockchain, and data analytics, the division aims to streamline processes, improve efficiency, and deliver more value to our clients.

Moreover, the division plays a key role in driving forward digital initiatives aimed at enhancing the client experience and expanding our service offerings. This may include developing user-friendly online portals for accessing legal documents, implementing virtual collaboration tools for remote consultations, or leveraging data-driven insights to provide more strategic and proactive legal advice.

In addition to driving internal digital transformation efforts, the division also serves as a thought leader and innovator in the legal industry, staying abreast of emerging trends, best practices, and regulatory developments related to technology and innovation. By fostering a culture of innovation and continuous improvement within our firm, the division ensures that we remain at the forefront of the rapidly evolving legal landscape.

Furthermore, the Innovation & Digital Transformation Division collaborates with clients to co-create innovative solutions tailored to their specific needs and objectives. Whether it's developing customized software applications, implementing digital marketing strategies, or leveraging blockchain technology for IP protection, the division helps clients embrace digital transformation and unlock new opportunities for growth and success.
• INVESTIGATION & DUE DILIGENCE UNIT

This specialized unit is tasked with conducting thorough investigations and due diligence assessments to uncover potential risks, liabilities, and opportunities that may impact our clients' interests.

Through a combination of open-source research, database analysis, and field investigations, the unit uncovers critical insights into the backgrounds, financial health, legal histories, and reputations of individuals and entities involved.

Moreover, the unit plays a key role in assessing compliance with legal and regulatory requirements, industry standards, and best practices. By conducting comprehensive due diligence reviews, the unit helps clients identify and mitigate risks related to anti-money laundering, corruption, fraud, sanctions compliance, and other regulatory matters.

In addition to transactional due diligence, the Investigation and Due Diligence Unit also supports clients in litigation and dispute resolution proceedings by gathering evidence, conducting witness interviews, and uncovering relevant facts to support legal strategies. Their expertise in investigative techniques and evidence collection enhances our firm's ability to build strong cases and achieve favorable outcomes for our clients.

Furthermore, the unit provides strategic counsel on risk mitigation strategies, reputational risk management, and crisis response planning. By proactively identifying potential risks and vulnerabilities, the unit helps clients make informed decisions and navigate complex business challenges with confidence.

In summary, the Investigation and Due Diligence Unit serves as a trusted partner to our clients, offering expertise in investigative techniques, due diligence assessments, and risk management strategies. By conducting thorough investigations and providing actionable insights, the unit enhances our firm's ability to protect our clients' interests, mitigate risks, and achieve their business objectives with integrity and confidence.

By leveraging advanced analytical techniques and proprietary methodologies, the division identifies emerging opportunities, potential threats, and competitive advantages that may impact our clients' business strategies and decision-making processes.

Through market surveys, focus groups, and sentiment analysis, the division helps clients understand customer preferences, market trends, and areas for differentiation, enabling them to develop targeted marketing strategies and product innovations that resonate with their target audience.

Moreover, the division plays a crucial role in conducting due diligence assessments related to intellectual property transactions, licensing agreements, and potential business partnerships. By evaluating the strength and validity of intellectual property assets, the division helps clients make informed decisions and mitigate risks associated with intellectual property ownership and exploitation.

In addition to proactive enforcement efforts, the Intellectual Property Investigation Division supports clients in litigation and dispute resolution proceedings by gathering evidence, conducting witness interviews, and providing expert testimony. Their expertise in investigative techniques and evidence collection enhances our firm's ability to build strong cases and achieve favorable outcomes for our clients.

By proactively identifying potential threats to our clients' intellectual property rights, the division helps clients develop comprehensive brand protection plans and mitigate risks associated with infringement and counterfeiting.

The Investigation Specialist collaborates closely with legal teams and client stakeholders to gather evidence of intellectual property infringement through various investigative techniques and tools. The Enforcement Specialist within our consulting and brand protection law firm serves as a critical asset in protecting and enforcing our clients' intellectual property rights. Furthermore, the division provides strategic counsel on risk mitigation strategies, reputational risk management, and crisis response planning. By proactively identifying potential risks and vulnerabilities, the division helps clients make informed decisions and navigate complex business challenges with confidence.

In summary, the Background Checks and Due Diligence Division serves as a trusted partner to our clients, offering expertise in background checks, due diligence assessments, and risk management strategies. By conducting thorough investigations and providing actionable intelligence, the division enhances our firm's ability to protect our clients' interests, mitigate risks, and achieve their business objectives with integrity and confidence.

The Shared Services Business Unit operates as a centralized hub, providing essential support services to legal teams and client-facing professionals. By centralizing administrative tasks such as billing, invoicing, payroll, and procurement, the unit streamlines processes, reduces redundancy, and enables legal professionals to focus more time and energy on delivering value-added legal services to our clients.

Moreover, the unit leverages technology and best practices to drive innovation and continuous improvement in service delivery. Through the implementation of advanced software systems, automation tools, and standardized processes, the unit enhances productivity, accuracy, and responsiveness, ultimately enhancing the overall client experience.
Finance & Data Science

The Finance & Data Science division holds a pivotal role in driving strategic decision-making, enhancing operational efficiency, and delivering value-added insights to our clients. This specialized division combines expertise in financial analysis, data analytics, and predictive modeling to support our firm's objectives and client engagements.

The Finance & Data Science division works collaboratively with legal teams, client stakeholders, and external partners to leverage data-driven insights and advanced analytical techniques to inform strategic decisions and optimize business processes. By analyzing financial data, market trends, and performance metrics, the division helps identify opportunities for growth, mitigate risks, and maximize return on investment for our clients.

Moreover, the division plays a key role in developing and implementing financial models, forecasting tools, and performance dashboards to support decision-making across various practice areas and client engagements. Through advanced data analytics, machine learning algorithms, and predictive modeling techniques, the division provides actionable insights and recommendations that drive business outcomes and inform strategic planning initiatives.

In addition to financial analysis, the Finance & Data Science division supports clients in areas such as pricing optimization, revenue forecasting, and cost-benefit analysis. By leveraging data-driven insights and quantitative analysis, the division helps clients make informed decisions that align with their business objectives and financial goals.
Marketing & Communications

the Marketing and Communications division is an essential component of our firm's success in building brand awareness, cultivating client relationships, and driving business growth. This specialized division is tasked with developing and executing strategic marketing initiatives, managing external communications, and enhancing our firm's visibility and reputation in the marketplace.

The Marketing and Communications division collaborates closely with legal teams, client stakeholders, and external partners to develop and implement comprehensive marketing strategies that align with our firm's goals and objectives. This includes identifying target audiences, crafting compelling messaging, and leveraging various channels such as digital marketing, social media, events, and public relations to effectively reach and engage prospective clients.

Moreover, the division plays a key role in developing thought leadership content, including articles, whitepapers, webinars, and presentations, to showcase our firm's expertise and differentiate our brand in the competitive legal landscape. By providing valuable insights and solutions to industry challenges, the division helps position our firm as a trusted advisor and thought leader in our areas of specialization.

In addition to external marketing efforts, the Marketing and Communications division also oversees internal communications initiatives to foster collaboration, alignment, and engagement among our team members. This includes disseminating important firm updates, sharing best practices, and promoting a positive firm culture that values teamwork, innovation, and excellence.
HR & Knowledge Management

HR & Knowledge Management division plays a crucial role in fostering a positive and productive work environment, attracting top talent, and maximizing the collective expertise of our firm. This specialized division is responsible for overseeing human resources functions and implementing knowledge management initiatives to support our attorneys and staff in delivering exceptional client service.

The HR & Knowledge Management division collaborates closely with firm leadership, legal teams, and staff members to develop and implement strategic HR policies and programs that align with our firm's goals and values. This includes recruitment and retention strategies, employee training and development, performance management, and compensation and benefits administration. By fostering a culture of diversity, inclusion, and professional growth, the division ensures that our firm attracts and retains top talent and maintains a high level of employee satisfaction and engagement.

Moreover, the division plays a key role in knowledge management initiatives aimed at capturing, organizing, and disseminating the collective knowledge and expertise of our firm. This includes developing and maintaining internal knowledge repositories, best practices guides, and training materials to facilitate knowledge sharing and collaboration among attorneys and staff. By leveraging technology and innovative solutions, the division enhances our firm's ability to access and apply relevant expertise to client matters, ultimately improving the quality and efficiency of our legal services.
Innovation & Technology

The Innovation & Technology division is instrumental in driving our firm's success by harnessing cutting-edge technologies and innovative solutions to enhance our legal services and meet the evolving needs of our clients. This specialized division is dedicated to exploring, adopting, and leveraging emerging technologies and innovative practices to optimize efficiency, improve client experiences, and stay ahead of industry trends.

The division plays a key role in driving digital transformation initiatives aimed at modernizing our firm's infrastructure, workflows, and client-facing platforms. By investing in technology solutions and digital tools, the division enhances our firm's agility, responsiveness, and ability to deliver high-quality legal services in today's digital-first world.

#1 INCIDENT REPORTING & MANAGEMENT
Description

list-items: Incident reporting and management serve as our primary defense against counterfeit and diversion incidents globally. Cultivating a culture of incident reporting is crucial for initiating a swift cross-functional response and understanding the severity of the threat. This practice requires immediate reporting of all incidents, analyzing trends, and escalating communications through established processes linked to Quality-based systems. It is imperative to document metrics related to the financial impact of incidents and recovery measures.

contents.content: High Impact Activities

list-items: Report all suspected incidents through the QA system.
Establish local incident response teams.
Manage and escalate incident responses with urgency.

contents.content: #2 AWARENESS & EDUCATION
Description

list-items: The objective of Education and Awareness programs is to enhance understanding of counterfeit and diverted products among the Company's associates and external partners. Elevating organizational awareness will enhance global effectiveness by empowering all associates to support brand protection efforts. Increasing awareness among external stakeholders will ultimately decrease demand for products purchased from unauthorized sources, thereby reducing counterfeits in the supply chain.

contents.content: High Impact Activities

list-items: Incorporate brand protection into orientation for new hires.
Provide specialized training for all call center, QA, and supply chain personnel.
Educate external partners about counterfeit concerns and the significance of purchasing from authorized sources.

contents.content: #3 MARKET MONITORING
Description

list-items: Market Monitoring encompasses programs aimed at identifying counterfeit, tampered, diverted, and trademark-infringed products in the marketplace. The objective of market monitoring is to enhance visibility of all illicit trade, thereby minimizing their adverse impact on patients, consumers, and business outcomes.

contents.content: High Impact Activities

list-items: Invest in suitable market monitoring tools for early detection and assessment of the problem.
Implement targeted market monitoring practices based on product risk assessments.

contents.content: #4 COMMERCIAL INSIGHTS
Description

list-items: Information obtained from proactive analysis of market and sales data offers valuable insights into supply chain activities, aiding in the identification of specific areas affected by counterfeits, illegal diversion, and other forms of illicit trade.

contents.content: High Impact Activities

list-items: Establish management thresholds in sales and marketing data to facilitate the detection of illicit trade.
Upon triggering by market monitoring data, conduct shipment/supply analysis to pinpoint sources of violations.
Conduct national/regional market surveys of distribution channels to assess the market presence of counterfeit or illegally diverted products.

contents.content: #5 DISTRIBUTOR COMPLIANCE
Description

list-items: Managing distributors and ensuring compliance is a crucial process in ensuring the safety and security of channels through which our products are delivered. Implementing effective distributor management practices for the selection and continuous evaluation of distributors will enhance supply chain control and visibility, thereby safeguarding distribution channels.

contents.content: High Impact Activities

list-items: Ensure contracts are in place for all Tier I distributors.
Incorporate ACF (Anti-Counterfeit Forensics) language in all distribution contracts.
Conduct audits of all Tier I distributors during the defined period of the agreement.

contents.content: #6 EXTERNAL MANUFACTURING
Description

list-items: External manufacturers play a crucial role in maintaining a safe and secure supply chain by supplying genuine products manufactured with our authorization, meeting our standards. However, the inherent risks to supply chain integrity associated with third-party manufacturing, including converters and repackaging operations, must be acknowledged, especially when these entities ship finished goods directly into the marketplace. This practice offers guidance on measures to mitigate some of these risks.

contents.content: High Impact Activities

list-items: Conduct External Manufacturing (EM) Risk Assessment to identify areas for improvement.
Emphasize operational controls to enhance visibility and mitigate risks.
Expand the EM audit scope to include practice requirements.

contents.content: #7 PRODUCT PROTECTION
Description

list-items: Product Protection involves a proactive, integrated, and multi-layered approach that utilizes processes and enabling technologies to safeguard products and packaging, thereby securing the supply chain from illicit diversion and counterfeiting. The objective of product protection is to maintain the integrity of our products to ensure that customers receive genuine Company goods.

contents.content: High Impact Activities

list-items: Conduct Product Risk Assessments on all new products using a Brand Protection/Legal-endorsed approach.
Coordinate product protection programs with market monitoring programs.
Selectively invest in serialization and track & trace to enhance visibility and control of the supply chain.

contents.content: #8 PRODUCT RETURNS AND DESTRUCTION
Description

list-items: Review the company's returned goods policies that offer credit for unused products. In some cases, returned goods are redressed and returned to the marketplace. By applying safe and secure measures to the returns process, detection of counterfeit products is enhanced, and the potential for diversion is reduced. Different companies have instituted policies and procedures to certify that damaged and unusable products are destroyed or appropriately disposed. The Product Destruction Practice specifies additional steps to prevent fraudulent reselling of product destined for destruction.

contents.content: High Impact Activities

list-items: Create highly detailed, unambiguous contract terms with trading partners, returns processors, and destruction facility.
Ensure all returned product is authentic or in the original, unopened package.
Ensure a thorough reconciliation process from receipt to disposition and/or destruction.
Establish procedures ensuring compliance with regional, regulatory, and environmental agencies.

contents.content: #9 TRANSPORTATION SECURITY
Description

list-items: Transportation Security applies best practices to all modes of transportation for cost-effective and secure management during the selection of a transportation provider as well as during ongoing operations. The deployment of these guidelines will help ensure control, visibility, and integrity of loads or products while in transit.

contents.content: High Impact Activities

list-items: Utilize a risk-based approach to determine the levels of security to transport Company products.
Facilitate customized, cost-effective solutions to enhance the security conditions in transportation.

contents.content: #10 FACILITY SECURITY
Description

list-items: This practice provides guidance for manufacturing facilities, warehouses, and storage locations to implement cost-effective security management procedures. These procedures are utilized during provider selection and operational processes to ensure control, visibility, and integrity of products during manufacturing or storage.

contents.content: High Impact Activities

list-items: Utilize a risk-based approach to determine the levels of security required to store Company products.
Facilitate cost-effective solutions to enhance security conditions in manufacturing and storage facilities.

contents.content: #11 INVESTIGATIONS, LEGAL & ENFORCEMENT STRATEGY
Description

list-items: This practice provides guidance for conducting investigations and developing high-impact legal enforcement strategies that leave a lasting impact. Effective communication is an essential element of any legal strategy.

contents.content: High Impact Activities

list-items: Management and Enforcement of IPR/Trademark Rights: Inform about the importance of a company's intellectual property. Identify strategies to register and manage intellectual property globally, including registrations of IPR in the EU, China, India, UAE.

Enforcement Strategy and Execution Plan: Evaluate all applicable laws for brand protection, including but not limited to IPR laws. Develop an enforcement strategy (mix of civil, criminal, and administrative) to meet legal and business goals and objectives.

contents.content: #12 MEASURE IMPACT AND SPEND
Description

list-items: This practice provides guidance on measuring the impact of Brand Protection spend and role. The primary principle is that whatever gets measured, gets done.

contents.content: High Impact Activities

list-items: Define Metrics to measure success.
Brand Protection Financial Recovery.
Brand-Protection Risk Avoidance.
ROI Calculation.
Build Brand Protection ROI Calculator.
KPI Development.

Identifying relevant internal stakeholders, defining roles and responsibilities, engaging, conducting training to reinforce ways of working, delivering relevant information to stakeholders, and conducting periodic reviews.
Each activity leads to outcomes, and those outcomes lead to impact. Ultimately, the activities are designed to minimize the risk of adverse incidents and legal/regulatory liability.

contents.content: OPPI
contents.shortinfo: The Organisation of Pharmaceutical Producers of India (OPPI) established in 1965, represents the research-based global pharmaceutical companies in India. OPPI has been an integral part of the healthcare journey of the country

contents.content: CII
contents.shortinfo: The Confederation of Indian Industry (CII) works to create and sustain an environment conducive to the development of India, partnering industry, Government, and civil society, through advisory and consultative processes.

contents.content: INTA
contents.shortinfo: The International Trademark Association is a global community of brand owners and professionals dedicated to supporting trademarks and related IP.
